content.prompt:
• Residual Plot for f:
    • The horizontal axis is labeled x. No values are indicated.
    • The vertical axis is labeled Residuals. It ranges from negative 1.0 to 1.0 in increments of 0.5.
    • 7 points are plotted. 
    • The 7 points are equally spaced relative to the horizontal axis.
    • From left to right, the approximate Residuals values of the 7 plotted points are as follows: 
      • negative 0.7 
      • 0.4
      • 0.41
      • 0.42
      • negative 0.55
      • 0.5
      • negative 0.48
  • Residual Plot for g:
    • The horizontal axis is labeled x. No values are indicated.
    • The vertical axis is labeled Residuals. It ranges from negative 6 to 6 in increments of 1.
    • 7 points are plotted. 
    • The 7 points are equally spaced relative to the horizontal axis.
    • From left to right, the approximate Residuals values of the 7 plotted points are as follows:
      • negative 5
      • negative 0.2
      • 2.5
      • 5.1
      • 2.9
      • negative 0.5
      • negative 4.8

Two regression models f and g are constructed from a data set. The residual plots for both models are shown. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: Model f is justified as appropriate for the data set because the residual plot does not show a pattern.
Model f is justified as appropriate for the data set because the residual plot does show a pattern.
Model g is justified as appropriate for the data set because the residual plot does not show a pattern.
Model g is justified as appropriate for the data set because the residual plot does show a pattern.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
